oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: School buses; Buses; Vehicles; Transportation
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Passenger bus labeled "Tennessee School For The Deaf." It is parked in front of the Administration Building on the school's campus.

The Athletic Association of the Tennessee School for the Deaf revived a bus fund in the fall of 1938 and began seriously raising money to purchase a bus for the use of the athletic teams. The committee heading up this effort was composed of Chairman Conley Akin, Publicity Chairman J.M. Smith, Jr., and Treasurer Harley Bishop. Alumni, pupils, teachers, and friends contributed. The institution received its bus in the fall of 1940.
